OUS: From a moral perspective, people should care about the well-being of all human beings on the planet equally; they should not favor the well-being of  people who are especially close to them either physically or emotionally.
Answers bhavinjawade/SOLAR-10B-OrcaDPO-J: This survey question presents a moral statement and asks the respondent to indicate their level of agreement using a 7-point Likert scale. The statement suggests an egalitarian view of moral responsibility where individuals should prioritize the well-being of all humans equally without showing preference for those who are geographically socially or emotionally closer to them. The Likert scale provides a range of responses allowing the respondent to choose from strongly agreeing to strongly disagreeing as well as options for neutral or moderate agreement/disagreement. This type of question can help researchers understand people's moral values and perspectives on global equity and fairness.
